AW: "I'm not resentful of the fans. I do not want to make stupid headlines. I just feel that if my personality is in the way of what our club is, that's more important than me."

AW: "I feel that this club has a fantastic image, and for me that is absolute vital. Sport is about winning and losing - you have to accept we will lose games even when I am not here."

Arsene asked if he is relieved: "No, because I don't feel tired". He does not sound remotely like a man who wanted to go.

AW on what to find in next manager: "Take me, and find a guy who is much stronger in every strong point I have."

AW: "It was different with Ferguson. He's not at the club."

AW: "I know it will be difficult for me, but I had many difficulties in my life and I will face this one as well."

AW asked if he'd manage again in England: "If you speak about emotions, that certainly for me would be emotionally difficult. I don't know how well I will live without that, so it's difficult for me to say never..."

AW: "It's a mixed feeling... I'm touched by all the praise I've got... after that, I had the feeling to be at my funeral - I don't need to die anymore!"
